statements: UPSERT INTO predictive_analytics_table (id, customer_id, prediction) VALUES (1, 1001, 'up'), (2, 1002, 'down')
UPSERT INTO predictive_analytics_table (id, customer_id, prediction) VALUES (3, 1003, 'up')
UPSERT INTO predictive_analytics_table (id, customer_id, prediction) VALUES (4, 1004, 'down')
UPSERT INTO Customer (customer_id, name, age, gender) VALUES (1, 'Alice', 30, 'Female') ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE name = 'Alice', age = 30, gender = 'Female';

UPSERT INTO PurchaseHistory (purchase_id, customer_id, product_name, purchase_date, amount) VALUES (1, 1, 'Laptop', '2022-03-15', 1500.00) ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE product_name = 'Laptop', purchase_date = '2022-03-15', amount = 1500.00;
UPSERT INTO Customer (customer_id, name, age, gender) VALUES (2, 'Bob', 35, 'Male') ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE name = 'Bob', age = 35, gender = 'Male';

UPSERT INTO customer_data (customer_id, customer_name, age, city, email) VALUES (1, 'John Doe', 30, 'New York', 'john.doe@example.com') ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE customer_name = 'John Doe', age = 30, city = 'New York', email = 'john.doe@example.com';

UPSERT INTO purchase_history (purchase_id, customer_id, purchase_date, total_amount) VALUES (1, 1, '2022-08-15', 100.25) ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE customer_id = 1, purchase_date = '2022-08-15', total_amount = 100.25;

UPSERT INTO product_catalog (product_id, product_name, category, price) VALUES (1, 'Laptop', 'Electronics', 999.99) ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE product_name = 'Laptop', category = 'Electronics', price = 999.99;
UPSERT INTO customers (customer_id, customer_name, age, email) VALUES (1, 'Alice', 30, 'alice@example.com');
UPSERT INTO transactions (transaction_id, customer_id, transaction_date, amount) VALUES (1, 1, '2022-11-30', 100.50);
UPSERT INTO products (product_id, product_name, category, price) VALUES (1, 'Product A', 'Electronics', 499.99);
